sen.j: 正親町 季俊（おおぎまち すえとし、天正14年9月18日 (旧暦)（1586年10月30日） - 寛永2年11月29日 (旧暦)（1625年12月28日））は、江戸時代初期の公家。
sen.e: Suetoshi OGIMACHI (October 30, 1586- December 28, 1625) was a kuge in the early part of the Edo period.
Suetoshi OGIMACHI (October 30, 1586- December 28, 1625) was a kuge in the early part of the Edo period.
Suetoshi OGIMACHI (October 30, 1586- December 28, 1625) was a kuge in the early part of the Edo period.

sen.j: おもに後水尾天皇（108代）に仕えた。
sen.e: He mainly served the Emperor Gomizuinoo (108th).
He mainly served the Emperor Gomizuinoo (108th).
He mainly served the Emperor Gomizunoo (108th).

sen.j: 正親町季秀（従一位権大納言）の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of Suehide OGIMACHI (Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) in Juichii (Junior First Rank)).
He was the second son of Suehide OGIMACHI (Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) in Juichii (Junior First Rank)).
He was the second son of Suehide OGIMACHI (Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) in Juichii (Junior First Rank)).
sen.cmt: Gon Dainagon→Dainagonの統一表記に基づき修正

sen.j: 母は烏丸光康（権大納言）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Mitsuyasu KARASUMARU (Gon Dainagon).
His mother was a daughter of Mitsuyasu KARASUMARU (Gon Dainagon).
His mother was a daughter of Mitsuyasu KARASUMARU (Gon Dainagon).

sen.j: はじめ兄の正親町季康が、跡継ぎだったが、父に先立って横死したため、かわって嫡男となった。
sen.e: At first, his brother Sueyasu OGIMACHI was a heir, but he died earlier than their father, and as a result, Sueyoshi became a heir instead of his brother.
At first, his brother Sueyasu OGIMACHI was a heir, but he died earlier than their father, and as a result, Sueyoshi became a heir instead of his brother.
At first, his brother Sueyasu OGIMACHI was a heir, but he died earlier than their father, and as a result, Sueyoshi became a heir instead of his brother.

sen.j: 慶長14年（1609年）に従五位下に叙任して元服。
sen.e: He was assigned to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in1609 and celebrated his attainment of manhood.
He was assigned to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in1609 and celebrated his attainment of manhood.
He was assigned to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) in1609 and celebrated his attainment of manhood.

sen.j: 翌年に侍従となり、さらに慶長17年（1612年）には従五位上右近衛少将となり、元和 (日本)3年（1617年）には従四位上右近衛中将・蔵人となった。
sen.e: In the next year, he was assigned to jiju (a chamberlain) and Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1612, and Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) in Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1617.

In the next year, he was assigned to jiju (a chamberlain) and Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1612, and Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) in Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1617.

In the next year, he was assigned to jiju (a chamberlain) and Ukone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) in Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1612, and Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Kurodo (Chamberlain) in Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) in 1617.
sen.cmt: 原文に基づき、Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain)→Kurodo (Chamberlain) に修正

sen.j: 元和9年（1623年）に正四位上参議となり、公卿に列するが、まもなく死去。
sen.e: In 1623 he was promoted to Sangi (councilor) in Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and raised to the peerage as Kugyo (the top court officials), but died soon after that.
In 1623 he was promoted to Sangi (councilor) in Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and raised to the peerage as Kugyo (the top court officials), but died soon after that.
In 1623 he was promoted to Sangi (councilor) in Shoshiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and raised to the peerage as Kugyo (the top court officials), but died soon after that.
